tool_description:
An API service to obtain **datacenter and residential proxies.**

###### Features:
* This service contains pools of **stable and high-quality proxies** that automatically rotate to ensure that you get a new different proxy with each API call.
* Each request to this API service will provide you with a new proxy available for 30 mins.
* Proxies are constantly monitored to ensure their health.
* You can extend the allocation time of a datacenter proxy by making successive calls to the API, with ...
name: Ephemeral Proxies
title: Ephemeral Proxies

api_list.name: Get user's traffic balance
api_list.description: It returns the user's traffic balance for current monthly subscription.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://ephemeral-proxies.p.rapidapi.com/v2/residential/balance"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ephemeral-proxies.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://ephemeral-proxies.p.rapidapi.com/v2/residential/balance"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ephemeral-proxies.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

success.description: True if operation succeeds, false otherwise

limit_megabytes.description: Total number of megabytes for current monthtly subscription.

consumed_megabytes.description: Number of megabytes the user has consumed for the current monthtly subscription.

api_list.name: Obtain a new datacenter proxy
api_list.description:
The connection proxy details are `proxy.host` and `proxy.port` from the response fields.
The proxy will allow connections from the same source IP as the one making this API call. Make use of the `whitelist_ip` parameter to allow an additional ip.
Countries can be selected by using the `countries` parameter, otherwise the country is randomly selected. A list of countries is available on *Service Status* endpoint.
The proxy is available for 30 mins.

optional_parameters.name: countries
optional_parameters.description:
List of countries, separate it by comma, that you would like the proxies to be located.
Example: GB,US,PL,RU

optional_parameters.name: whitelist_ip
optional_parameters.description:
The proxy that this endpoint returns will allow connections from the source ip that is making this API call.
Additionally, you can allow an extra ip to connect to the proxy by setting this parameter to the ip that you would like to whitelist.
The list of ips that the proxy has whitelisted is returned in the API response.

success.description: True if operation succeeds, false otherwise

expires_at.description: Expiration time of the proxy. Once a proxy has expired, connections can no longer be stablished with the proxy.

whitelisted_ips.description: List of ips that proxy will allow connections from.

visibility.description:
Details, including IP address, that the target will see when you connect using this proxy.
For example, if you connect to www.google.com using the proxy, Google will see yor source ip as the one listed here.

country_eu.description: Whether the country is in Europe

static.description: A static proxy will always use the same ip when connecting to the target.

api_list.name: Check residential proxies service status
api_list.description: It returns the current status of the service, including the total number of residential proxies available and grouped by country.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://ephemeral-proxies.p.rapidapi.com/v2/residential/service_status"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ephemeral-proxies.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

proxies.description: Total number of proxies for country

api_list.name: Extend expiration time of a datacenter proxy
api_list.description:
By calling this endpoint the expiration time of an already allocated proxy will be extended by 30 mins.
Successive calls will keep incrementing the expiration time, up to a maximum of 24 hours.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: The proxy identifier to extend the expiration time. This identifier can be obtained from the response of /v2/datacenter/proxy, field proxy.id.

success.description: True if operation succeeds, false otherwise

expires_at.description: Expiration time of the proxy. Once a proxy has expired, connections can no longer be stablished with the proxy.

whitelisted_ips.description: List of ips that proxy will allow connections from.

visibility.description:
Details, including IP address, that the target will see when you connect using this proxy.
For example, if you connect to www.google.com using the proxy, Google will see yor source ip as the one listed here.

country_eu.description: Whether the country is in Europe

static.description: A static proxy will always use the same ip when connecting to the target.
